intro: Astragalus sericans, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are compound, with pairs of small, narrow leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus sericans is often found in open habitats such as grasslands, sagebrush steppe, and disturbed sites.
